channel.title: Posts on Jonas Adler
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Jonas Adler

item.title: Learning to reconstruct
item.description: Suppose that you were given a blurred image: Then you could probably tell that it was generated from this image: But what about if you instead were given indirect observations of the image, such as the line integrals taken over some set of lines: Would you still tell it came from the image above? Probably not. But we will demonstrate how we can teach a computer to do it.

item.title: Dual GPU configuration in Ubuntu 16.04 and CUDA 8.0
item.description: Instructions for installing and configuring Ubuntu 16.04 LTE on a PC with two GPUs. The primary GPU will be used for computations and the secondary one will be used for displaying graphics. In this example, the computer is a HP Z640 with NVIDIA Titan-X Pascal as primary GPU and a NVIDIA Quadro K620 as secondary GPU. Note: if the computer already have a working installation of Ubuntu 16.04 with build-essentials installed you should (probably) not have to reinstall it, meaning that the first two steps can be skipped.
